key_risks: Regulatory and compliance issues, including $30 million in fines for violations of customer identification rules and deficient third-party risk management practices
Cybersecurity risks due to reliance on digital banking platforms and third-party service providers
Economic sensitivity tied to the New York metropolitan area, increasing vulnerability to regional downturns
Intense competition from traditional banks and fintech companies, threatening market share and profitability
Stock volatility and investor concerns following a 27.6% drop in March 2023
controversies: Fined $30 million by the Federal Reserve and New York State Department of Financial Services for regulatory violations
Allegations of breach of contract and breach of good faith and fair dealing in legal disputes
social_issues: Focus on underserved markets, such as minority-owned businesses and startups, which could drive growth but also increase operational risks
governance_issues: Regulatory deficiencies in anti-money laundering (AML) and third-party vendor oversight
Heavy reliance on third-party vendors for core banking systems and cybersecurity, increasing operational risks

sources.title: Federal Reserve Board issues enforcement action and fines Metropolitan ...
sources.snippet: The Federal Reserve Board on Thursday issued an enforcement action and fined Metropolitan Commercial Bank, of New York, New York, approximately $14.5 million for violations of customer identification rules and for deficient third-party risk management practices relating to the bank's issuance of prepaid card accounts.
